name: Alaska Airlines, Inc.
description: Alaska Airlines, Inc. is a major American airline headquartered in Seattle, Washington. Founded in 1932, the airline has grown to become the fifth-largest airline in the United States, serving more than 115 destinations across the United States, Canada, Mexico, and Costa Rica. Known for its commitment to customer service, Alaska Airlines is recognized for its high-quality in-flight experience, including complimentary snacks and beverages, as well as a variety of entertainment options. The airline operates a fleet of over 300 aircraft, primarily consisting of Boeing and Airbus models, and is part of the Oneworld alliance, which enhances its global connectivity and offers customers more travel options. Alaska Airlines places a strong emphasis on environmental sustainability, implementing initiatives to reduce carbon emissions and improve fuel efficiency. The company has been a leader in the industry for its innovative use of technology to enhance customer experiences, including mobile check-in and real-time flight updates. With a focus on safety and reliability, Alaska Airlines continues to expand its routes and improve its services, all while maintaining a strong commitment to the communities it serves.

seo.meta_title: Alaska Airlines, Inc. | Major American Airline
seo.meta_description: Explore Alaska Airlines, Inc., a major American airline known for its excellent service and commitment to sustainability. Discover routes, services, and more.

faq.question: What services does Alaska Airlines provide?
faq.answer: Alaska Airlines provides passenger air travel, including Economy, First Class, and Premium Class services.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Alaska Airlines?
faq.answer: Ben Minicucci is the CEO of Alaska Airlines, Inc.

faq.question: Where is Alaska Airlines headquartered?
faq.answer: Alaska Airlines is headquartered in Seattle, Washington, USA.

faq.question: What is Alaska Airlines' loyalty program?
faq.answer: Alaska Airlines offers the Mileage Plan loyalty program, which rewards frequent flyers.
